reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay at the Carmel Village Inn. Location - at the end of Ocean Ave - is great. The room was clean and comfortable and, while this is an older property, it is apparent that the owner maintains it. The continental breakfast is fine and those desiring fuller breakfasts can find such within a couple of blocks of walking. Being an older property, the walls are a little thin and conversations outside your room door/window can be easily heard. That said, for the long weekend, all was quiet after 9pm.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Carmel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a great night here, everything you could need, clean spacious room and lots of parking. Continental breakfast was really nice and the lady working there very pleasant. Would recommend it.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This inn is a great value. It is very clean, great location, and within walking distance of shopping and restaurants.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Village Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a cozy little breakfast area that provides a complimentary
reviews.title: Great little motel.

likes.liked: — Quaint property, clean and cozy rooms, nicely landscaped areas, onsite parking.
likes.disliked: — Can be very busy during peak periods.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position of the motel is perfect: on the main road of Carmel, near galleries and shops. Generally people at the reception is polite and smart.
reviews.title: Well positioned but modest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very basic, in a tipical motel setting, with a small bathroom.
reviews.title: Decent for a motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a Carmel stop in a long travel is good. Do not take it as an hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this place is definitely the location. It is right on top of the village of Carmel and a few blocks walk to the beach. It's really terrific.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: On the downside, it's a motel, not an inn. The walls are thin, the bathroom is basic, and the breakfast is Cheerios in a small box and some bad coffee. We were there over Labor Day weekend and so the rate was high - $200 / night.
reviews.title: Thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: I adored this little place. The location was fabulous and there are lots of Hugh Comstock storybook cottages in the hills behind the hotel - very cool. The room was simple, but had character. The gentlemen behind the desk were exceptionally helpful and kind. Continental breakfast spread was excellent. Coffee was above average. The deli behind the hotel on 6th Street is FABULOUS. Get the hot BBQ tri-tip sandwich with cheddar. Oyvey.....it was delish. My room was around 90 bucks with tax. I will definitely return to this place. Wireless service was a bonus.
reviews.title: Affordable & Cute

likes.disliked: — My room was in front of a staircase

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We rented 2 adjoining rooms here over Xmas - 1 room for my parents & 1 room for ourselves and our 3 year old son. Feels like the quirky beach cottage of an eccentric aunt. Outdated decor, odd closets everywhere, weak coffee - BUT also spotlessly clean, quiet, nice plantings all around, very convenient. We appreciated having a little kitchen, nicely stocked, with full sized range & sink. Also room's large size, vaulted ceilings & gas fireplace made it a nice place to hang out. The location was great - and VERY ACCESSIBLE for my mother, who has limited mobility - park right out front and you're across the street from shops, restaurants, and a little park.
reviews.title: Funky beach cottage feel - great location & well-kept up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Village Inn in October 2006.
reviews.title: Great location for an affordable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found it to be in a great location, (all the art galleries and shops are in walking distance.) We were celebrating our anniversary and realy enjoyed our stay. The rooms are basic, but comfortable. Since there is no air conditioning...you need to have the windows open and that does make it noisy. I had to use earplugs for that, (plus my husband snores!)
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The personell in the office was kind and very helpful and the maid service was great. I forgot my blowdryer and they had one for me to borrow.
reviews.title: Good, small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There are lots of places to choose from in the area - we went to a couple of them, and settled on Village Inn because of the friendliness / helpfulness of the guy on reception. We weren't disappointed! Great location - minutes from the shops / bars / restuarants. Remodelled nice room - powerful shower, and felt safe staying there for the night. Variety of stuff to choose from for breakfast - recommend it as a place to stay. Paid $89 plus tax for 2 queen beds.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: second time here .the first was ten years ago.this is still a great value place to stay. rooms perfectly adaquate for the money.location is excellent to walk to everything in carmel.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights after driving up the California coast the first week of December. The location is great, right at the top of the Ocean Avenue shopping and dining district. The rooms are on the small size but comfortable. We were on the first floor where there were cars parked right up the front of the rooms. Light sleepers might want to ask for a room on the 2nd floor or off the parking area. The continental breakfast was simple (bagels, cereal, fruit etc) but fresh and the sitting area was pleasant. We were able to exchange ideas about restaurants, sightseeing with the manager and other guests easily. We were able to get a $99 rate for a room with a king size bed, and felt it was excellent value for the money.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Carmel Village Inn on a whim after our trip to San Diego was cancelled for our anniversary. The Inn is located in a perfect area of Carmel in the heart of shops, excellent restaurants, galleries, pubs, cafe's, a great beach to take in the sunset, and neighborhoods of interesting architecture. The room was clean, spacious, comfortable, quiet, and parking was free.
reviews.title: Perfect location - clean, friendly, affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morning breakfast, which is included, was cereal, oatmeal, pastries, bagels, toast, english muffins, fruit, juice, coffee, tea.... you get the picture. The staff was great and had a good sense of humor when we checked in. We stayed in a first floor, standard room.
reviews.title: Great location and room

likes.disliked: — Parking is on a first come first serve basis and can get busy
